0 deposito de ouro do Cabayal esta localizado na poryao SW do Craton Amaz6nico, municipio de Araputanga, Estado do Mato Grosso. Esta inserido na Faixa Cabayal do greenstone
belt do Alto Jauru, associado a uma zona de cisalhamento de direyao N20-40W/SW, resultante de
uma tect6nica de cavalgamento com movimento de SW para NE.
Rochas intrusivas na sequencia vulcano-sedimentar, tais como, o gabro-norito Indiavai
(1688 ±45 Ma, Sm-Nd), o tonalito Cabayal (1636 Ma, U-Pb) eo granito Alvorada (1523 ±278 Ma,
Rb-Sr), conferem ao greenstone belt do Alto Jauru uma idade minima referida ao Proteroz6ico
Inferior.
0 minerio polimetalico do Cabayal esta hospedado em rochas felsicas vulciinicas e
vulcanoclasticas e ocorre em bandas concordantes com a foliayao milonitica das rochas hospedeiras
e ainda como brecha e em veios de quartzo e carbonato. A mineralizayao principal consiste de
calcopirita, pirita, marcassita, pirrotita, esfalerita, galena, ouro, bismuto, selenetos e teluretos,
associados principalmente a quartzo, clarita, carbonato, sericita e biotita subordinada.
A idade da mineralizayao foi determinada em tomo de 1700 Ma (Pb-Pb em galena) e a idade

as razoes mais baixas obtidas em veios concordantes com a foliayao milonitica e as mais altas, em

ABSTRACT
DISSERTACAO DE MESTRADO
Fhivio Henrique de Toledo
The Cabayal gold deposit is located at the southwestern portion of the
Amazon Craton, State of Mato Grosso, Brazil, along the Cabayal tract of the Alto
Jaru greenstone belt. This deposit is structurally-controlled by a WSW dipping,
N20-40W ductile shear zone formed during a regional event of NE-directed
tectonic overthrusting.
The Alto Jaru greenstone belt is intruded by a multitude of rocks, such as
the Indiavai noritic gabbro, the Cabayal tonalite and the Alvorada granite, which
yielded Sm-Nd, U-Pb and Rb-Sr ages around 1688 ±45 Ma, 1636 Ma, 1523 ±278
Ma, respectively. These indicate an age of greenstone belt emplacement framed
within the Early Proterozoic.
The Cabayal mineralization is hosted in felsic voulcanic and voulcanoclastic
rock and occurs as (i) flat bands concordant to the mylonitic foliation, (ii)
breccias, as well as (iii) quartz-carbonate veins. The ore is polymetalic and
consists of chalcopyrite, pyrite, marcasite, pyrrhotite, sphalerite, galena, gold,
bismuth and minor selenides and tellurides. These are commonly associated with
quartz, chlorite, carbonate, sericite and minor biotite.
The mineralization is related to hydrothermal alteration processes. Whole-
rock Rb-Sr and single mineral (sericite) K-Ar radiometric determinations provide
ages of 1638 ±48 Ma and 1645 ±78 - 1615 ±65 Ma, respectively, for the X
hydrothermal episode. Pb-Pb radiometric dating of galena yields an age around
1700 Ma for ore emplacement. These ages are similar to those obtained for the
syn- to late-tectonic Caba<;:al tonalite.
Initial 87 Sr/ 86 Sr ratios in carbonates from mineralized veins range from
0.7029 to 0.7144. The lower ratios are found in vems parallel to the mylonitic
foliation. These ratios were interpreted as associated to fluids evolved from deep
sources such as the gneissic basement and tonalitic magma chambers. Higher 87 Sr/ 86 Sr ratios are usually akin to carbonates from late, discordant and brecciated
mineralized veins, suggesting that these precipitated from the reaction between
late hydrothermal fluids and the supracrustal rocks. The Pb/Pb ratios in galena
from the polymettalic ore also indicate fluids and metal contributions from
primitive reservoirs both in the lower and Upper Crust.
Mineralogical, chemical and isotopic data support an epigenetic origin for
the Caba<;:al deposit, which is depicted here as a shear zone-hosted, mesothermal
base-metal gold mineralization developed contemporaneously to surrounding
tonalitic plutonism.
This study reveals evidences that the Alto Jaru greenstone belt underwent an
important tectonic event at around 1. 7 Ga, comprising a complex assembly of
metamorphism, plutonism, deformation and hydrothermalism processes, which lead
to the formation of the Caba<;al gold deposit.

CONTRIBUICAO A GEOLOGIA DO ALTO JAURU
No presente capitulo sao apresentados os resultados dos estudos

resultados obtidos nas data<;:oes radiometricas de algumas unidades

de verificar se as rochas a serem datadas conferiam com os tipos
litol6gicos descritos na literatura. Por outro lado, tanto os estudos
petrograficos como os geocronol6gicos foram orientados a testar a
idade minima do greenstone belt, ate entao atribuida ao Arqueano, uma

3.1 - ESTUDOS PETROGRAFICOS E LITOGEOQUiMICOS
Os principais litotipos constituintes do greenstone belt Alto Jauru

3.1.1- METAVULCANICAS BASICAS
Estas rochas apresentam em geral uma colora<;:ao cinza

afirica. Elas sao constituidas fundamentalmente de anfib61io e quartzo.

Associada a pilha vulcanica foi tambem estudada uma rocha claramente sub-vulcanica (no. 70, PQM-10), com granulac;:ao mais

Litologias correspondentes aos termos mais ultrabasicos

As amostras analisadas sao fundamentalmente constituidas de

Trata-se de uma rocha de colora9ao cinza escuro a media,
